here is steam work around the windows defender lesson for all of you who need it.  first de-activate your windows defender when you download and install a game downloaded off of a torrent.  do NOT delete the install files and also if the torrent is a install-less, then make a zip file of the downloads as a back up.  then after install or making zip back up, activate the windows defender.  run the game and the windows defender message will show.  now goto windows defender history tab and select the top of the three choices and click show history.  go and select the list and check the file name, folder.  next de-activate the windows defender, re-install or unzip the zip back up, then goto settings tab of windows defender and then set that file to exceptions list.  turn back on the windows defender and you are good to go.  steam games are usually the steam_api.dll that needs this done.  thanks for reading and hope this helps you helpless computer junkies who aer never sober to figure this out.  enjoy good gaming~!

if you get the error message msvcp110.dll is missing goto http://www.microsoft.com/en-au/download/details.aspx?id=30679 and download it.vsu1vcredist_x64.exe is for laptops and vsu1vcredist_x86.exe is for desktop.Also add the ManaGame file to your exceptions in your Antivirus program if you get a black screen or it freezes at the Capcom screen.
I said steam work around but other games work the way I said around as well...  sorry about misinforming you, peeps~!
